Question
========
Consider a bell-shaped distribution. Use the *z*-table to determine the percentage of observations that lie between $\overline{y}$ - 1.5*s* and $\overline{y}$ + 1.5*s*.

Answerlist
----------
* 81.50%
* 86.64%
* 93.32%
* 99.70%
